reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Fostering Dialogue Around the Red Sea

description.narrative: The area comprising the Red Sea and the Horn of Africa currently forms a major theatre in several overlapping conflict systems that are operating at local, national, regional and geo-strategic levels. Shifting alliances and political instability characterize the region. In large part, Yemen remains the only open widespread armed conflict. However, unpredictability is a defining feature of both sides of the Red Sea. The potential for spill-over and a resurgence of other conflicts remains a tangible threat. Extant and latent conflicts include but are not limited to territorial disputes, internal ethno-political divisions and competition for scarce natural resources. Each of these issues require a contextually appropriate approach whilst ensuring sensitivity to the broader conflict system. The heightened tensions in the region and the conflicts surrounding it are not only resulting in protracted violence and poverty but also increasingly deepening divisions. The current fragmentation and competing interests within the Red Sea region will continue to fuel instability and undermine common understanding and multilateralism. The overall objective of CMI’s project is to enhance regional cooperation on conflict prevention around the Red Sea.
